channel.title: You configured a non-loopback address
channel.description:
so after a CLI restart tor I see this Apr 16 host Tor[890]: You configured a non-loopback address ' for HTTP TunnelPort. This allows everybody on your local network to use your machine as a prox…what you wanted.
multiple lines
is this OK "safe", normal , etc ?
ty

item.title: You configured a non-loopback address
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi mT8RGF

That Arm message is expected.

https://whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Controller#Arm_FAQ

Tor really listens on that IP/port. It is Whonix-Gateway’s network interface, that is only available to Whonix-Workstations, because it is an internal network with Whonix-Workstation and because Whonix-Gateway is firewalled (see /usr/bin/whonix_firewall or in Whonix source code).

Read full topic

item.title: You configured a non-loopback address
item.dc:creator: awokd
item.description:
Yes, that is how Whonix works.

Read full topic
